_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The three excellent horses [an3.141:6.9]: Fast, but not beautiful or well-proportioned
Fast and beautiful, but not well-proportioned
The three excellent people [an3.141:6.9]: Fast, but not beautiful or well-proportioned
Fast and beautiful, but not well-proportioned
How an excellent person is fast, but not: With the ending of the five lower fetters, they are reborn spontaneously
They are extinguished there and are not liable to return from that world
When asked a question about the teaching or training, they falter without answering
They don’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
How an excellent person is fast and beau: With the ending of the five lower fetters, they are reborn spontaneously
They are extinguished there and are not liable to return from that world
When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering
They don’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
How an excellent person is fast, beautif: With the ending of the five lower fetters, they are reborn spontaneously
They are extinguished there and are not liable to return from that world
When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering
They receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
